__Michael Ditto Jr - Medical Malpractice 04/11/2023__
From: Sarena Tuttle [sarena@whaleylawfirm.com](mailto:sarena@whaleylawfirm.com)
To: Cameal Stafford [reddcameal@gmail.com](mailto:reddcameal@gmail.com)
CC: Aaron Whaley [agwhaley@whaleylawfirm.com](mailto:agwhaley@whaleylawfirm.com), Bryce Koon [bryce@whaleylawfirm.com](mailto:bryce@whaleylawfirm.com)
Date: Fri, 13 Dec 2024 13:27:10 -0500

Good afternoon Cameal,
 Thank you so much for completing the Minor Intake for Michael Jr. Can
you please clarify your relationship with Michael Ditto Sr? Are you
married? If not, has custody been decided by a Family Court? Is Michael Sr
actively involved in Michael Jr's life? I do not mean to be intrusive,
however, custody is a relevant issue for minor claims.
 I see on the Intake that Michael was born on 04/07/2023 and was in
ICU at Norton Hospital. Was this the Downtown location?
 Then on 04/11/2023 Michael was to have a routine circumcision but
there was an issue found at his 1st primary care check up. Correct? Who is
the Primary Care Physician?
 Micheal was then referred for a revision surgery, looks like in
December of 2023, is that the correct date? Who completed this revision
surgery?
 I see you noted that you made a complaint to Norton Hospital, do you
have any records of these complaints for your file?
 Has Micheal received any other treatment such additional surgeries,
therapy or any follow up visits? If so, please provide us with a complete
list of any and all doctors Michael has seen.
 As soon as we receive the requested information, we will get medical
record requests out to get copies of all Michael's medical records and
place Norton Healthcare on Notice of Michael's claim. Please keep in mind
this part of the process can take 30-45 days to get the records & a proper
response from Norton Healthcare. We ask for your patience during this time,
however, please feel free to contact us directly with any questions that
may arise. We look forward to assisting Michael and working with you &
Michael Sr as things progress.

Sarena M. Tuttle
Litigation Paralegal &
Workers' Compensation Case Manager
The Whaley Law Firm
712 Lyndon Lane
Louisville, KY 40222
D: (502) 357-9971
O: (502) 583-4022 ext 104
E: Sarena@WhaleyLawFirm.com
(PLEASE NOTE NEW EMAIL ADDRESS)

In the note titled Michael Ditto Jr - Medical Malpractice 04/11/2023, the communications trace a specific email regarding the Michael Ditto Jr. matter. The email is from Sarena Tuttle of The Whaley Law Firm to Cameal Stafford, with Aaron Whaley and Bryce Koon cc’d, dated Friday, December 13, 2024 at 13:27:10 Eastern Time. The purpose of the message is to follow up on the Minor Intake for Michael Jr. and to request clarifications and additional information necessary for advancing the minor’s claim.

In the body of the email, Sarena thanks Cameal for completing the Minor Intake for Michael Jr. and asks several clarifying questions. She asks for details about Cameal’s relationship with Michael Ditto Sr., specifically whether they are married, whether custody has been decided by a Family Court if not married, and whether Michael Sr. is actively involved in Michael Jr.’s life, noting that custody is a relevant issue for minor claims. She references information in the intake indicating that Michael was born on 04/07/2023 and was in the ICU at Norton Hospital, asking whether this was the Downtown location. She then notes that on 04/11/2023 Michael was to have a routine circumcision, but there was an issue found at his first primary care check-up, and asks who the Primary Care Physician (PCP) is.

The email also asks for confirmation regarding a revision surgery, questioning whether it occurred in December 2023 and who completed that revision surgery. Sarena mentions a complaint that had been made to Norton Hospital and asks whether there are records of those complaints for the file. She inquires whether Michael has received any other treatments, such as additional surgeries, therapy, or any follow-up visits, and asks for a complete list of all doctors Michael has seen.

Regarding next steps, Sarena states that once the requested information is received, the firm will initiate medical record requests to obtain copies of all of Michael’s medical records and will place Norton Healthcare on Notice of Michael’s claim. She cautions that this part of the process can take 30–45 days to obtain the records and a proper response from Norton Healthcare. She asks for patience during this period and invites direct contact with any questions that may arise. The email concludes with a note of looking forward to assisting Michael and working with Michael Sr. as the matter progresses.

Tuttle, a Litigation Paralegal and Workers’ Compensation Case Manager at The Whaley Law Firm, wrote back with clarifying questions. In that email, KillA StyleS indicates an attempt to access Michael Ditto’s Norton MyChart to obtain exact names and dates of the treating doctors for the record. On the same day, December 13, 2024, at 1:59 PM (approximate), Sarena M. Tuttle, a litigation paralegal and workers’ compensation case manager at The Whaley Law Firm, responded. She also asked whether Michael’s primary care physician is affiliated with Norton Dutchman, and provided her contact information and new email address.

In a reply later that day, KillA StyleS confirmed that she and Michael Ditto Sr. are married and that Michael Jr. lives at home with them. She stated that Michael was born at Norton Dutchman Lane location. She reported that she immediately complained about the initial circumcision date of 4/11/23, noting that Heather Gusic, APRN, did not record that there were any problems or complaints in her notes regarding Michael Jr.’s case files. She also said she filed a complaint with Norton Dutchman Hospital at the phone number 502-559-4490. Norton Dutchman Hospital offered to pay for Michael Jr.’s re-circumcision and repair surgery scheduled for 12/12/23. She stated that she complained to Michael’s primary care provider at the six-week check-up that he was in pain and that the circumcision was not going well, and she was referred to his urologist at the Norton Dutchman location, who she said has extensive notes on everything.

Later on December 13, 2024, at 1:27 PM, Sarena Tuttle sent another email to Cameal (the sender’s name in KillA StyleS’s messages) acknowledging the completion of the Minor Intake for Michael Jr. She requested clarification of Cameal’s relationship with Michael Ditto Sr., asking whether they are married and, if not, whether custody has been decided by a Family Court and whether Michael Sr. is actively involved in Michael Jr.’s life, noting that custody is a relevant issue for minor claims. She stated she saw in the intake that Michael was born on 04/07/2023 and was in ICU at Norton Hospital, asking whether this was the Downtown location. She asked for confirmation that on 04/11/2023 Michael was to undergo a routine circumcision but that an issue was found at the first primary care check-up, and she asked who the Primary Care Physician was. She inquired whether Michael’s revision surgery occurred in December 2023 and who completed that revision. She asked if there were any records of the complaints to Norton Hospital and requested copies of those records. She asked whether Michael had any other treatments, such as additional surgeries, therapy, or follow-up visits, and requested a complete list of all doctors Michael has seen. She stated that once the requested information is received, medical record requests would be issued to obtain copies of all of Michael’s medical records and to place Norton Healthcare on notice of Michael’s claim. She noted that the process can take 30–45 days to obtain the records and a proper response from Norton Healthcare, asked for patience, and invited direct contact with any questions. The email concluded with Sarena’s signature, including her title and contact details at The Whaley Law Firm.

In summary, the communications center around securing and consolidating Michael Ditto Jr.’s medical records related to a potential medical malpractice claim, confirming family relationships and custody considerations for a minor claimant, clarifying the treatment timeline (including the 04/11/2023 circumcision and the December 2023 revision), and coordinating record requests to Norton Healthcare facilities (Norton Dutchman Hospital and Norton Urology) with attention to dates, locations, and involved providers.

Case: Michael-Ditto-Jr-Med-Mal-04-11-2023. Client: Michael Ditto.

In the matter titled “Re: Michael Ditto Jr - Medical Malpractice 04/11/2023,” a communication was sent on December 13, 2024 from KillA StyleS (reddcameal@gmail.com) to Sarena M. Tuttle at Whaley Law Firm (sarena@whaleylawfirm.com). The message references Elisha McAmont, a urologist, located at 3999 Dutchman Ln, Plaza 1, Suite 6F, Louisville, KY 40207, and notes that there is a substantial amount of documentation on Michael Jr.

The thread shows that KillA StyleS indicated on December 13, 2024 at 2:33 PM that there had been substantial documentation. In response, on December 13, 2024 at 2:09 PM Sarena Tuttle wrote that she would also obtain a request for records and that she would send information as soon as possible. She stated that there is enough information to get started and that she would request records for all departments and physicians.

Sarena Tuttle’s message provided her contact details and emphasized that they would request records from Norton Hospital Dutchman, Norton Hospital, and Norton Urologist, and asked for any information to be sent. The note appears to be part of a workflow to gather medical records and begin processing the claim.

Earlier messages show that on December 13, 2024 at 2:05 PM KillA StyleS mentioned the primary care location as Stonestreet 40272 and that they were trying to access Michael Norton MyChart to obtain the exact names and dates of doctors for the file.

At 1:59 PM on December 13, 2024, Sarena Tuttle responded: she would update the file and issue record requests to Norton Hospital Dutchman and Norton Urologist as soon as possible, and she asked whether Michael’s Primary Care Physician was also with Norton Dutchman.

At 1:50 PM, KillA StyleS clarified that he and Michael Sr. are married, that Michael Jr. lives at their home, and that Michael was born at Norton Dutchman Ln location. He stated that he immediately complained about the initial circumcision date of 4/11/23 because Heather Gusic, APRN, did not record any problems or complaints in her notes regarding Michael Jr. He reported filing a complaint with Norton’s Dutchman Hospital at the number 502-559-4490, and that Norton Dutchman Hospital offered to pay for Michael’s re-circumcision and repair surgery on 12/12/23. He also noted that at Michael’s six-week check-up with his primary care provider, Michael Jr. was in pain and the circumcision was not progressing well; he was referred to the urologist at the Norton Dutchman location, who, according to him, has extensive notes on everything.

At 1:27 PM, Sarena Tuttle sent a detailed inquiry requesting clarifications regarding Michael Ditto Sr.’s relationship to Michael Jr. (whether they are married, and if not, whether custody has been decided in Family Court and whether Michael Sr. is actively involved in Michael Jr.’s life). She explained that custody is a relevant issue for minor claims. She confirmed that the intake indicated Michael was born on 04/07/2023 and was in the ICU at Norton Hospital, and she asked whether this was the Downtown location. She asked for confirmation that on 04/11/2023 Michael was scheduled for a routine circumcision but an issue was found at the first primary care check-up, and she inquired about the Primary Care Physician. She asked whether there was a revision surgery in December 2023 and who completed that revision. She requested any records of complaints filed with Norton Hospital and asked for a complete list of all treatments, additional surgeries, therapy, or follow-up visits, including every doctor Michael has seen. She stated that once the information is received, they would issue medical record requests to obtain copies of all of Michael’s medical records and place Norton Healthcare on notice of the claim; she noted that this process can take 30–45 days and asked for patience, inviting direct questions. She concluded with her Whaley Law Firm contact details: Sarena M. Tuttle, Litigation Paralegal & Workers’ Compensation Case Manager, The Whaley Law Firm, 712 Lyndon Lane, Louisville, KY 40222; D: (502) 357-9971; O: (502) 583-4022 ext 104; E: Sarena@WhaleyLawFirm.com.

Overall, the exchange centers on gathering complete medical and custodial information related to Michael Ditto Jr.’s birth in 2023, the circumcision performed on 04/11/2023 and subsequent treatment including a proposed revision surgery in December 2023, complaints filed with Norton Hospital (including a specific complaint to Norton Dutchman Hospital and a request regarding payment for re-circumcision/repair), and the team’s efforts to obtain comprehensive records from Norton Health systems, with the aim of advancing a medical malpractice claim. Further detail and confirmation from the involved parties were requested to assemble a full medical history and determine custodial involvement for purposes of the minor claim.

On December 13, 2024, The Whaley Law Firm began consolidating records for the Michael Ditto Jr. medical malpractice case, noted as case Michael-Ditto-Jr-Med-Mal-04-11-2023, with client Michael Ditto. The discussion centers on events around his birth and early circumcision in 2023. Michael Ditto Jr. was born on 04/07/2023 and was in the ICU at Norton Hospital; the hospital location is referenced as Norton (Downtown location is questioned in intake notes). The initial circumcision was scheduled for 04/11/2023, but the family alleges there were problems that Heather Gusic, APRN, did not record in her notes. The family reported filing a complaint about this to Norton Hospital, using the phone number 502-559-4490 and noting a Google Maps reference to “712 Michael re-circumcision and repair Surgery 12/12/23.” The family also complained to Michael’s primary care at his six-week check-up, stating that he was in pain and that the circumcision was not resolving properly, after which they were referred to a Norton Dutchman location urologist who has extensive notes on the case.

In the email thread, Sarena M. Tuttle asked KillA StyleS to confirm whether United Insurance was Michael’s health insurance and to provide a copy of any health insurance coverage. She stated that a record request had been sent to Norton and that Norton Healthcare would be placed on Notice once records were obtained, noting that the process to secure records from Norton Healthcare could take 30–45 days. She also indicated that she had sent record requests to Norton Hospital Dutchman and to Norton Urologist and that they would request records from all departments and physicians as needed.

The communications show an effort to assemble doctor and facility details through Michael Ditto Jr.’s MyChart (to obtain exact names and dates of doctors) and to determine whether the primary care physician is affiliated with Norton Dutchman. The team planned to proceed with record requests to Norton Hospital Dutchman and Norton Urologist as soon as possible and to obtain copies of records from all involved departments and physicians.

Cameal (the individual who completed the Minor Intake) provided key biographical and factual details. She confirmed that she and Michael Ditto Sr. are married, that Michael Jr. lives in their home, and that he was born at Norton Dutchman Ln. She stated the initial circumcision occurred on 04/11/2023 and that Heather Gusic, APRN, did not record any problems or complaints in her notes regarding Michael Jr. She reported filing a complaint with Norton Dutchman Hospital (with reference to the complaint and a contact number) and a complaint to Michael’s primary care at six weeks, stating that Michael was in pain and that the circumcision was not progressing well, and that they were referred to a urologist at Norton Dutchman location who has extensive notes.

Cameal also noted that she and Michael Sr are married, that Michael Jr. was born 04/07/2023 and was in ICU at Norton Hospital, and that the Downtown location was a question in the intake. She indicated that the family’s intent is to have Norton Hospital and Norton Urology’s records obtained and to place Norton Healthcare on Notice, with the understanding that this process may take 30–45 days to secure records and a proper response.

The record of the exchange includes the exchange of contact details for Norton-related providers, including Elisha McAmont, a urologist located at 3999 Dutchman Ln, Suite 6F, Louisville, KY 40207, noted in the thread as having substantial documentation on Michael Jr. The thread also references Norton Urology and Norton Hospital Dutchman as primary targets for record requests, the need to obtain copies of all of Michael Jr.’s medical records, and the intention to pursue notices with Norton Healthcare while documentation is gathered. In sum, the team is actively requesting comprehensive records from Norton Hospital Dutchman, Norton Urology, and associated departments and physicians, seeking health insurance information (noting United Insurance) and using MyChart to identify treating clinicians, with custody and guardianship considerations acknowledged as part of the minor’s case.

This note documents the email exchanges on December 13, 2024, concerning Michael Ditto Jr., a minor whose case is listed as Michael-Ditto-Jr-Med-Mal-04-11-2023. The client is Michael Ditto. The discussions involve KillA StyleS (reddcameal@gmail.com) and Sarena M. Tuttle, a Litigation Paralegal and Workers’ Compensation Case Manager at The Whaley Law Firm.

Early in the thread, an email from KillA StyleS to Sarena Tuttle references that Elisha McAmont, a urologist, is located at 3999 Dutchman Lane, Suite 6F, Louisville, KY 40207, and notes that there was a substantial amount of documentation regarding Michael Jr. The message also records that the primary care was at Stonestreet (ZIP 40272), and that there was an effort to access Michael Norton’s MyChart to obtain exact names and dates of doctors. In addition, KillA mentions that Michael Sr. and Michael Jr. have a connection to Norton Dutchman and Norton Hospital, and that a complaint had been filed with Norton regarding the circumcision issue.

Sarena Tuttle’s response, sent on December 13, 2024 around 2:40 PM, expresses the hope that Michael Jr.’s records will contain everything needed. She asks whether United Insurance is Michael’s health insurance and requests a copy of any health insurance coverage he has. She also notes that she has sent a request to Norton and that they will keep KillA posted as things progress. She identifies herself with her full title and contact information at The Whaley Law Firm and notes her new email address.

Earlier in the same day, KillA provides continuing details about the case. There is a line about “Elisha McAmont urologist” and the address cited earlier, and KillA reiterates that there is a lot of documentation on Michael Jr. She indicates she is providing or has provided information about the urologist and associated records.

Around 2:09 PM, Sarena replies again to confirm that she will also send a record request to Norton Hospital and Norton Urologist. She requests that any information be sent as it becomes available, since they already have enough to begin work and will request records from all departments and physicians as needed. She reiterates the role and contact details for herself at The Whaley Law Firm.

At about 2:05 PM, KillA notes the primary care is at Stonestreet and that she is attempting to access Michael Norton’s MyChart to obtain exact names and dates of doctors for the file.

At approximately 1:59 PM, Sarena replies with appreciation for the information and explains that she will update the file and issue record requests to Norton Hospital Dutchman and Norton Urologist as soon as possible. She asks whether Michael’s Primary Care Physician is also with Norton Dutchman.

At around 1:50 PM, KillA confirms a marital relationship: she and Michael Ditto Sr. are married, reside together, and that Michael Jr. was born at Norton Dutchman Lane location. She states that she immediately complained about the initial circumcision date of 4/11/23, noting that Heather Gusic, APRN, did not record any problems or complaints in her notes for Michael Jr.’s file. She reports filing a complaint with Norton’s Dutchman Hospital (the number 502-559-4490 is listed) and says Norton Dutchman Hospital offered to pay for Michael Jr.’s re-circumcision and repair surgery on 12/12/23. She mentions that she complained at Michael’s six-week check-up with his primary care about pain and that the circumcision was not going well, and that they referred her to his urologist at the Norton Dutchman location who has extensive notes on everything.

Earlier still, at 1:27 PM, Sarena had written to Cameal (KillA) with several substantive questions. She asked for confirmation of Michael Ditto Sr.’s relationship to Michael Jr. (whether they are married, and if not, whether custody has been decided by a family court and whether Michael Sr. is actively involved in Michael Jr.’s life). She noted that custody is relevant for a minor claim. She asked for clarification that Michael was born on 04/07/2023 and was in the ICU at Norton Hospital, asking whether this was the Downtown location. She inquired whether 04/11/2023 was the date Michael was to have a routine circumcision but that an issue was found at the first primary care check-up, and asked who the primary care physician was. She also asked whether Michael was then referred for a revision surgery (appearing to be in December 2023), who completed the revision surgery, and whether there were records of complaints filed with Norton. She requested a complete list of all other treatments, surgeries, therapy, or follow-up visits and all doctors Michael has seen. She explained that once the requested information is received, the firm would issue medical record requests to obtain copies of all Michael’s medical records and place Norton Healthcare on notice of the claim. She cautioned that the process can take 30-45 days to obtain records and a proper response from Norton Healthcare, and invited further questions as progress continued. She signed off with her title and contact information for The Whaley Law Firm.

In sum, the December 13, 2024 exchanges reflect ongoing steps to gather Michael Ditto Jr.’s medical records and health insurance information, confirm care providers and locations (including Norton Dutchman Hospital and the Norton Urologist, with a referenced involvement of Heather Gusic APRN and observer notes from an urologist), and to determine custody and familial involvement in Michael Jr.’s case. The law firm intends to place Norton Healthcare on notice of the claim and to obtain all relevant records, acknowledging that the record collection process may take 30-45 days and requesting patience while the process unfolds.
